channel.title: Php/sql question
channel.description: First, how do remove duplicates via phpmyadmin, then order it according to near duplicates, and if 4/5th of it is a duplicate, how would I make a function to echo something different? Sorry if this may be confusing, I can make image examples when I get home, I am at a state compitition at the moment, and I just finished my test.

item.title: Php/sql question
item.dc:creator: @kloplop321 kloplop321
item.description:
@kloplop321 wrote:

the ID’s are only for starting and ending, I already made a php script to handle a skip in the ID’s

I am using this for dumping code for my AI thing, as it is, I want to do something like instead of
[php]
if(o1.fingers == 4 && o2.fingers == 0 && p1.fingers ==3 && p2.fingers== 4)
{
oacton=“rhl”;

if(o1.fingers == 4 && o2.fingers == 0 && p1.fingers ==3 && p2.fingers== 4)
{
oacton=“lhl”;
}[/php]

It will echo
[php]
var fahn = random(1,2);
if(o1.fingers == 4 && o2.fingers == 0 && p1.fingers ==3 && p2.fingers== 4){
if (fahn == 1){
oacton=“rhl”;
}else{
oacton=“lhl”;
}
}[/php]

This is for making Action-script. as if I had as the first, it will go according to the second if statement because it overrides the first because it has the same qualifications to do that procedure.

Read full topic

item.title: Php/sql question
item.dc:creator: @N00b1 N00b1
item.description:
@N00b1 wrote:

well first off what is it being used for that would help.

one other thing if you are using auto increment for the id then if it deletes one it will not update the id’s as in id you had a list of id’s like 12345 and you got rid of no 3 it would be 1245 just to let you know
